page.title: 03Housing - Deene
page.content:
Deene is overshadowed by Deene Hall and its estate, but the village street is lined by picturesque detached cottages, three terraced units, the old school & schoolhouse, a large Georgian building- part of which is Manor Farm, and the remainder was the Â£Seahorse' pub which closed in the 1970's (now uninhabited). A second farm-Home Farm-is situated at the western end of the settlement. All homes were built of local limestone -and in addition to slates and tiles, there are examples of thatching.
Deene Hall (the Brudenell home) is also a stone residence, developed over five centuries, with the extensive house and estate buildings covering many acres.
